Comment: The problem is that the left tends to go off in 10,000 different directions out of a misplaced sense of moral rectitude, and the whole thing falls apart. E.g., the chaotic attempt to derail the Kavanaugh nomination.   You focus on what’s landing *because it’s landing*, which means it drives clicks, which means you keep getting headlines, which means lower info people think it’s a big deal, which means the needle moves, which means the El Salvador transfers become such a political loser both here and for Bukele that DHS can’t keep doing them.

Comment: If enough Dem Representatives win the House, they will.  But it will be a tough climb to win enough Senate seats in 2026 to convict.   I think they need to consider the bigger picture, though.  Impeaching Trump will only fire up his base and further fuel third-term aspirations, because, you know, he would be 'robbed' of full term and is owed.  I mean, he speaks as if he legit already won a third term, and because his second term was stolen, he should be allowed the third (because, he already won it).    But, this will gave Vance a solid year to prove his case, which could backfire for Dems or could backfire for him.   Allowing Trump to serve a full four years might be what is needed to wake up the other half of the country that this shit is not cool.
